private_information: I can move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H
I must only issue moves for disks A..H
I should obey Tower of Hanoi rules: never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Help move disk C to the right peg while restoring A and B on the left peg so the final configuration has disk C alone on the right peg and A,B on top of D on the left peg.

private_information: I can move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O
I must only issue moves for disks I..O
I should obey Tower of Hanoi rules: never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Assist if moves of disks I..O are required. For this instance no moves of I..O are necessary to achieve the stated goal.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver
I must integrate agents' move lists and ensure actions remain distinct per agent
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' primitive moves and produce a PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards planner that represents the environment, legal moves, agent-specific action signatures, initial state, and goal state.

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, right.
There are 15 disks labeled A,O inclusive where A is the smallest and O is the largest.
Initial configuration on the left peg from top to bottom is A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
Middle peg is empty and right peg is empty in the initial configuration.
Goal configuration is: left peg from top to bottom A, B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg empty; right peg has disk C alone on top.
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk moved at a time, only the top disk of any peg may be moved, and no larger disk may be placed on a smaller disk.
Agent movement restrictions: agent_1 may move disks A through H. Agent_2 may move disks I through O.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You are an expert in Tower of Hanoi primitive moves and cooperative sequencing. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you (agent_1) will execute, in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk movement restrictions (A..H). Do not emit PDDL. If no moves are required, return an explicit empty list or a short statement 'no moves required'.
plan_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Use the public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. The global goal is: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Think step by step and provide the ordered list of primitive moves in the exact required format. Only include moves for disks you are allowed to move.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You are an expert in Tower of Hanoi primitive moves and cooperative sequencing. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you (agent_2) will execute, in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk movement restrictions (I..O). Do not emit PDDL. If no moves are required, return an explicit empty list or a short statement 'no moves required'.
plan_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Use the public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. The global goal is: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Think step by step and provide the ordered list of primitive moves in the exact required format. Only include moves for disks you are allowed to move.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file formatted and tuned for the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions distinct per agent, reflecting agent-specific action signatures if needed. Integrate the primitive moves provided by the agents as part of the problem constraints or as guidance to verify the plan. Do not change agent movement restrictions.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator integrating agents' outputs to achieve the global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is the move list produced by agent_1: {moves_agent_1}. Here is the move list produced by agent_2: {moves_agent_2}. Think step by step. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem tailored to the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the agents' actions distinct in the domain, and ensure the initial state and goal state correspond to the environment specification.
